Each year the Willard City School District receives federal funds to supplement programs for students in our district. Currently, these funds are used for salaries, benefits, supplies and professional development. Parents and community members are invited to submit suggestions regarding how the funds should be used.

Suggestions can be submitted to Jenni Smith, 123 W Whisler Dr., Willard, OH 44890. Federal funds received to supplement our current programs are Improving Basic Programs, Title I-A; Migrant Education, Title I-C; Improving Teacher Quality, Title II-A; Limited English Proficient, Title III; Student Support and Academic Enrichment, Title VI-A; Rural and Low Income, Title VI-B; Special Education, Part B-IDEA; and Early Childhood Special Education, IDEA.

The public is also invited to a brief meeting that will be held Monday, March 23, 2020, to discuss how these funds should be used. The meeting will be held at the Board of Education Office, 123 W Whisler Dr., Willard, OH at 1:30 pm.

ROX (Ruling Our Experiences) is truly having a positive impact on both our MS and HS girls!
The goal of the program is to positively and purposefully impact the life course of girls and to assist them in becoming EMPOWERED, CONFIDENT and PRODUCTIVE women.
The girls meet in small groups over the course of 20 weeks to discuss topics such as healthy assertiveness, healthy relationships/friendships, social media and its influence on self-perception, safety & self-defense, healthy body image, leadership & career development and stress & coping skills. Providing girls with a supportive environment where they are valued, able to take risks and try out new behaviors allows them to see themselves as capable of mastering difficult relationships, situations and choices ~ and to Rule Their Own Experiences!
Michelle Aplin, school counselor has been facilitating this national program for the last 3 years and is doing a fantastic job with these girls!

Dear Parents/Guardians:
The Willard City School district is happy to announce the adoption of an innovative new website and mobile device app entitled HERE COMES the BUS.

Here Comes the Bus allows you to view the real-time location of your child's school bus on your smartphone, tablet or computer.

Here comes the bus enables you to:
* See the location of you child's bus both before and
after school

*Confirm that your child's bus has arrived at the bus
stop, at school or both.

*Receive a push notification or email message when
the bus is a certain distance from your stop.

To learn more about the Here comes the bus app visit...
https://herecomesthebus.com/

Should you have any further questions, please contact Michael Lillo via email at lillo.mike@willardschools.org or by phone at 419-935-1541, ext. 46004.

"Kids First",
Michael Lillo, Transportation Director
